items.title: The ALSO. Electric Bike's Rivian-Inspired Battery
items.author: Munro Live
items.summary:
- Munro Live (Munro & Associates) applies Lean Design to examine a Rivian-inspired battery concept for an electric bike.
- The video hints at behind-the-scenes teardown insights aimed at reducing cost while improving efficiency and quality.
- Key implications include ROI gains, safety/thermal considerations, and how lean product development could shape future EV batteries.

items.title: ALSO.'s In-House Electric Bike Propulsion System
items.author: Munro Live
items.summary:
- Munro Live is the media arm of Munro & Associates, the home of Lean Design (leandesign.com), promoting design efficiency to maximize ROI.
- Content includes behind‑the‑scenes engineering, teardowns, and reimagined products and processes to cut cost and raise quality.
- Engage via X/Twitter, Instagram, LinkedIn, or email Sales@leandesign.com; Patreon offers exclusive content.

items.title: You Can Swap the Seat on the ALSO. Electric Bike!
items.author: Munro Live
items.summary:
- Demonstrates how to swap the seat on the ALSO electric bike and discusses practical considerations for riders.
- Frames the swap within Munro Live's Lean Design philosophy, highlighting design efficiency and ROI implications.
- Promotes behind-the-scenes content, teardowns, and the Lean Design community via social channels and Patreon.

items.title: The Munro Difference

items.summary:
- Munro Live is the media division of Munro & Associates, advocating Lean Design to optimize design efficiency and ROI.
- It features behind-the-scenes content, teardowns, and positions Lean Design as the home of efficiency and cost reduction.
- Social channels include X/Twitter, Instagram, LinkedIn, with an inquiries email and Patreon for exclusive content.

items.title: Maximize Your Manufacturing Efficiency With Munro & Associates!
items.author: Munro Live
items.summary: - Munro Live promotes Lean Design, a design-first methodology from Munro & Associates to optimize product design, cut costs, and boost ROI. - The channel shares behind-the-scenes teardowns and process reimagination to show how design choices affect manufacturing efficiency and quality. - As the home of Lean Design, it directs audiences to X/Twitter, Instagram, LinkedIn, and Sales@leandesign.com, plus a Patreon for exclusive content.
